What is RAM?
Random Access Memory, temporay storage for active program
What is a motherboard?
The main circuit board that connects all hardware components
What is a GPU?
Graphics Processing Unit, specialized for rendering images/video, doubles as AI processing unit these days
What is the difference between HDD and SSD?
normal hard drive (HDD) are slower but cheaper than Solid-State Drive, which does the same thing, storage device for long-term data
What is a scanner?
a device that converts physical documents into digital images
List three input devices
Keyboard, mouse, microphone
List three output devices
Monitor, webcam, speakers
What is cache?
Fast, small memory near CPU for quick data access
What is an optical drive?
A device that reads/writes CD, DVD, etc
What is cloud storage?
The online equivalent of HDD, remote data storage
What does HDMI stand for?
High Definition Multimedia Interface (transfer both video/audio)
What is the term to call computer accessories?
peripherals
What is USB/micro USB/Type C etc?
different standards for connecting peripherals
What is Bluetooth?
Wireless tech for short-range device communication
What is Thunderbolt?
Apple's high-speed port that transfers data, video, power, i.e. typc C
What is a modem?
device that connects to the ISP for internet access
What is a NUC?
Next Unit of Computing, a mini desktop
What is the difference between desktop and a laptop?
desktop: need peripherals, customizable, not portable. laptop the opposite
What is a blue screen of death?
Critical system error that can not be self fixed
What is a driver?
A piece of file to install that determines how a particular hardware functions
How is resolution defined?
By the number of pixels, Width x Height (e.g., 1920x1080 = Full HD)
What is refresh rate?
How many times the screen updates per second, 60HZ etc
What is HDR?
High Dynamic Range, brighter highlights and deeper shadows for better contrast
What is a Chromebook?
A laptop running ChromeOS, instead of Windows. (usually cheaper, and cloud-focused)
What is the biggest advantage a touchpad has over mouse?
Touchpad supports the use of gestures like pinch-to-zoom
What is the use of a wireless adapter?
Adds wifi/bluetooth to device lacking built-in support
What is a card reader?
Reads SD/micro SD cards
What is the main difference between using SD card, USB stick, or portable HDD for storage?
SD: small, expensive, portable / USB: average in all three / HDD: large, cheap, bulky
Which is cheaper for the same specs, laptop or desktop, by how much roughly?
For the same specs, desktop is roughly half of the price of a laptop
What is the typical lifespan of a PC, before feeling outdated?
around 5 years
